title: If i had to give my opinion on Orianna's kit
body:
https://i.gyazo.com/29b8a7993d9d85aa2133946091abca0f.png

So far there are only 2 things that i find too powerful compared to other mages tbh

**shockwave cooldown : 110 / 95 / 80**
Shockwave is a teamfight beast spell, the damage and the decent CC duration brings a classic strength to a mage. It can also be used to bring back an enemy, basically it's strong. But unlike other mages the cooldown is insanely low at rank 3
80 sec cd makes it feel in late game like orianna can miss an ult if someone flashed, but she can just wait (even better with cdr) for a minute to get it back.

{{champion:115}} ultimate is as powerful, and yet has 120 sec cd at all ranks
{{champion:112}} storm is similar with AOE damage and CC, but the cd is 120/110/100

**protect shield duration: 4 seconds**

Orianna as a mage should bring utility to her team.
she can shield for SHIELD STRENGTH: 80 / 120 / 160 / 200 / 240 (+ 40% AP) which is a lot since she can build AP
the problem is that the shield duration allows her utility to remove her weakness as a mage

A mage should be weak in 1v1 against an assassin or a diver. Orianna is not the case, her W allows her to be safe against them **while shielding herself constantly with E** , it has 9 sec cd and lasts for 4 sec, this leaves her oppenents little opportunitis to fight her like {{champion:92}} a long time ago, riot prevented her to shield herself constantly if she stacked CDR by nerfing her shield duration.

those 2 things are what i feel like things orianna has that makes her stronger than an average mage
Shield duration and Ult cd makes her too much forgiving to play and leaves little window of opportunities to her enemies

There is a massive difference between Orianna's shield and Riven's shield.

Riven's shield is instantaneous.
Orianna's shield is delayed until the ball reaches the target.

This means that Riven can use her shield reactive to enemy attacks mid-flight whereas Orianna's shield is basically used to hold off further aggression.
If you then nerfed Ori's shield duration, it would still not be able to reasonably use reactively, and because of how telegraphed it is, the enemies could easily hold their cooldowns for the duration of the ability, effectively putting Ori with one less ability.

Hey, i'm a fellow sanji fanboy https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/70/a1/bc/70a1bc4e4bc4c9d0dc960d2f3a246b77.gif

But she's not busted.

Early game (basically w/o double dorans or a lost chapter), her mana usage is off the charts, so it's very easy to get her in a predicament if you are pressuring her at the right times (Harassing in the ~1 second window when she throws the ball, forcing her to use her kit to protect herself, all that nonsense.) Ori is only "busted" to players when they are harassed by the ball, or when they bunch together and get ulted. I think she is a strong champion, no doubt, but she is also fair. If you let her have her way early, then of course the lane will give you trouble. She is a mage like all the others. Get her in mana troubles early, force backs, get a CS lead, play it smart, and the lane (and hopefully the game) is winnable. All about learning the matchup through trial and error :D
